The photograph: The expert verified the authenticity of the claim by confirming that the picture shared on social media indeed showed National Guard troops stationed around the Lincoln Memorial during the Black Lives Matter protests in June 2020. The expert mentioned that the picture was authentic and provided additional information from the caption on the Getty Images photograph.
Deployment of National Guard: The expert highlighted that the D.C. National Guard did deploy in response to the violent mob that attacked the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021. This deployment was approved by Vice President Mike Pence, contradicting initial reports that the troops would not be deployed. This aspect verifies that the National Guard was indeed involved in responding to the Capitol attack.
Context of the claim: The expert provided background information about the Black Lives Matter protests in the spring and summer of 2020. They mentioned that these protests were led by Black Lives Matter activists and were primarily peaceful, despite some instances of violence. This context supports the claim that the National Guard was deployed to protect the Lincoln Memorial during those protests.
Comparison with Capitol attack: The expert drew a comparison between the response to the Black Lives Matter protests and the Capitol attack by Trump supporters. They highlighted that the picture was being shared to demonstrate unequal law enforcement practices, emphasizing that the pro-Trump mob occupied the Capitol building for hours, vandalized the chamber, and engaged in various acts of violence. This aspect reinforces the significance of the National Guard deployment during the Black Lives Matter protests.
